facts.text: The New York Red Bulls were established in October 1994.
The New York Red Bulls began play in Major League Soccer's inaugural season in 1996 as the New York/New Jersey MetroStars.
In 2006, the team was sold to Red Bull GmbH and re-branded as part of the company's global network of soccer clubs.
The New York Red Bulls have played their home matches at Sports Illustrated Stadium in Harrison, New Jersey, since 2010.
New York City FC, which entered MLS in 2015, is the other MLS team based in the New York metropolitan region alongside the New York Red Bulls.
The New York Red Bulls have reached the MLS Cup final twice, in 2008 and 2024, losing both times.
The club has won three Supporters' Shield titles, in 2013, 2015, and 2018.
The New York Red Bulls reached the final of the U.S. Open Cup in 2003 and 2017, losing on both occasions.
The club reached the semi-finals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2018.
The club's original name was Empire Soccer Club.
Tab Ramos was the first player to sign with MLS and became the first MetroStars player.

The MetroStars selected players named Juninho and Túlio in the 1996 MLS Supplemental Draft, leading to a misunderstanding as they were not the well-known Brazilian players Juninho Paulista and Túlio Costa.
The MetroStars waived both Juninho and Túlio on March 25, 1996.
The team's first home game ended in a loss to the New England Revolution due to an own goal by Nicola Caricola, an event later dubbed the "Curse of Caricola."
In what year did the MetroStars change their naming convention to exclude any city, state, or regional geographic name, becoming a rarity in American sports? **1998**
Who set an MLS record by scoring five goals in a game for the MetroStars against the Dallas Burn on August 26, 2000? **Clint Mathis**
Which team did the MetroStars defeat to win the La Manga Cup in 2004, becoming the first MLS team to win a trophy outside of North American soil? **Norway's Viking FK**
In what year did Red Bull GmbH purchase the MetroStars, leading to the team's rebranding as "Red Bull New York"? **2006**
Who was hired as the Red Bulls' head coach after the departure of Mo Johnston during the 2006 season? **Bruce Arena**
On what date did the New York Red Bulls host the LA Galaxy for the league debut of David Beckham, drawing 66,238 fans? **August 18, 2007**
Which German club did the Red Bulls defeat 4-2 in a friendly at Giants Stadium during the summer following the Red Bull takeover? **Bayern Munich**
Who resigned as coach of the New York Red Bulls on November 5, 2007? **Bruce Arena**
In 2008, Altidore was sold to Villarreal for a U.S. record transfer fee.
The July 19, 2008, game between the New York Red Bulls and the Los Angeles Galaxy set the season record attendance for the team and the league with over 47,000 tickets sold.
The New York Red Bulls lost to Barcelona 6-2 in a friendly match on August 6, 2008.
The New York Red Bulls defeated D.C. United 4-1 on August 11, 2008, keeping them in the Eastern Conference playoff race.
The New York Red Bulls were the last team to qualify for the playoffs in the 2008 MLS season.
The New York Red Bulls made it to the 2008 MLS Cup final but lost 3-1 to the Columbus Crew.
The New York Red Bulls played their first match of the 2009 season against Seattle Sounders FC, who won 3-0 in their first MLS match.
The New York Red Bulls were eliminated from the 2009–10 CONCACAF Champions League in the qualifying round by W Connection.
The New York Red Bulls went on a 16-game winless streak from May 8 to August 23, 2009.
The New York Red Bulls had a 23-game winless streak on the road from May 10, 2008, to the end of the 2009 season.
Osorio resigned from his position as coach of the New York Red Bulls on August 21, 2009.
In 2010, Hans Backe was hired as the head coach of the Red Bulls.
Joel Lindpere became the first player to score a goal in Red Bull Arena during a preseason game against Santos of Brazil.
The Red Bulls signed Thierry Henry as a designated player in July 2010.
On August 2, 2010, the Red Bulls signed Rafael Márquez, making them the first MLS team to have three designated players.
The Red Bulls clinched first place in the Eastern Conference for the first time since 2000 in the 2010 season.
New York Red Bulls set an MLS record for best one-season improvement in 2010, finishing with 51 points after having just 21 points the previous year.
Joel Lindpere was named the Red Bulls' Most Valuable Player for the 2010 season.
Thierry Henry was announced as the captain of the Red Bulls for the 2011 season.
The Red Bulls lost to the Chicago Fire 4–0 in the quarterfinals of the U.S. Open Cup in July 2011.
The Red Bulls won the 2011 Emirates Cup, a friendly tournament hosted by Arsenal in London.
The Red Bulls were eliminated from the MLS Cup playoffs in the quarterfinals by the LA Galaxy in 2011.
Tim Cahill was signed as a designated player by the New York Red Bulls in July 2012.
The New York Red Bulls were eliminated from the Eastern Conference semi-finals in 2012 after losing their home leg 1–0 to D.C. United.
Hans Backe's contract with the New York Red Bulls was not renewed a few hours after their loss to D.C. United in the 2012 Eastern Conference semi-finals.
Mike Petke was announced as the permanent head coach of the New York Red Bulls on January 24, 2013.
Mike Petke became the first former MetroStars/Red Bulls player to coach the team in 2013.
The New York Red Bulls won the 2013 Supporters' Shield as the team with the best regular-season record.
The New York Red Bulls eliminated Sporting Kansas City in the knockout round of the 2014 MLS playoffs.
Thierry Henry retired following the 2014 season, and Tim Cahill was released during the offseason.
Ali Curtis replaced Andy Roxburgh as the Sporting Director of the New York Red Bulls on December 23, 2014.
Jesse Marsch was announced as the head coach of the New York Red Bulls on January 7, 2015, replacing Mike Petke.
The New York Red Bulls won their second Supporters' Shield in Jesse Marsch's first season as head coach.
The New York Red Bulls tied an MLS record for largest victory margin by winning 7–0 against New York City FC on May 21, 2016.
Bradley Wright-Phillips became the New York Red Bulls' all-time leading goal scorer by the end of July 2016, surpassing Thierry Henry.
The New York Red Bulls qualified for their first ever CONCACAF Champions League knockout stage on September 27, 2016.
Denis Hamlett replaced Ali Curtis as the Sporting Director of the New York Red Bulls prior to the 2017 season.
The New York Red Bulls reached the U.S. Open Cup Final for the second time in club history in 2017 but were defeated by Sporting Kansas City.
The New York Red Bulls were eliminated in the round of 16 of the 2016-17 CONCACAF Champions League by Vancouver Whitecaps FC.
Bradley Wright-Phillips scored his 100th goal for the New York Red Bulls in all competitions during the 2017 MLS playoffs.
The New York Red Bulls won their third Supporters' Shield and reached the semifinals of both the MLS Cup Playoffs and the CONCACAF Champions League in 2018.
In the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League quarterfinals, New York Red Bulls became the first MLS club to win by multiple goals on Mexican soil with a 2-0 defeat of Club Tijuana.
Bradley Wright-Phillips scored both goals in the New York Red Bulls' historic 2-0 win against Club Tijuana in the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League quarterfinals.
In the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League, the New York Red Bulls won the quarterfinal tie against Club Tijuana with an aggregate score of 5-1.
Kaku scored on his debut for the New York Red Bulls in the return leg of the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League quarterfinals against Club Tijuana.
The New York Red Bulls were eliminated from the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League in the semifinals by Chivas with a 1-0 loss in the tie.
Jesse Marsch left his role as coach of the New York Red Bulls in 2018 to join RB Leipzig, with Chris Armas taking over as head coach.
The New York Red Bulls won their third Supporters' Shield in 2018 after overtaking Atlanta United on the season's final day.
Bradley Wright-Phillips became the fastest player to score 100 MLS goals, achieving this milestone on July 25, 2018.
Bradley Wright-Phillips became the first player in MLS history to score 20 goals in a league season three times.
Tyler Adams was sold to RB Leipzig in January 2019 for $3,000,000 and 33% of any future transfer earnings.
In the 2019 season, 20 different New York Red Bulls players scored at least a goal, setting a club record.
The New York Red Bulls were eliminated in the quarterfinals of the 2019 CONCACAF Champions League by Santos Laguna.
Luis Robles and Bradley Wright-Phillips, holding records for most appearances and most goals for New York Red Bulls respectively, departed the club in the offseason following the 2019 season.
Sean Davis was named the first academy product to captain the New York Red Bulls ahead of the 2020 season.
Chris Armas was released from his contract as head coach of the New York Red Bulls on September 4, 2020.
Caden Clark scored on his debut, second appearance, and postseason debut for New York in the second half of the 2020 season.
Gerhard Struber was hired as the manager of New York Red Bulls on October 6, 2020.
Gerhard Struber made his debut as New York Red Bulls manager in the 2020 MLS Cup Playoffs with a 3–2 away loss to Columbus.
Bento Estrela became the New York Red Bulls' youngest-ever signing the day before his 15th birthday.
New York Red Bulls qualified for their 12th consecutive playoffs in the 2021 season.
The New York Red Bulls were defeated by the Philadelphia Union 1–0 in the opening round of the playoffs with a goal in the 123rd minute.
Lewis Morgan was bought from Inter Miami CF for $1.2 million in targeted allocation money before the 2022 season.
The New York Red Bulls tied an MLS record by winning their first five league games on the road at the start of the 2022 season.
New York Red Bulls reached the semifinals of the Open Cup in the 2022 season before losing 5–1 to Orlando City.
Jochen Schneider was appointed as Head of Sport for New York Red Bulls on June 11, replacing Kevin Thelwell.
New York Red Bulls qualified for the MLS Cup Playoffs for a 13th-consecutive season, setting the active league record.
New York Red Bulls lost to FC Cincinnati in the first round of the playoffs in the 2022 season.
Sean Nealis was named captain of the Red Bulls, becoming the first New York-born player to wear the armband.
The Red Bulls signed forward Dante Vanzeir from Belgian side Union SG for a reported fee of $5.3 million.
Dante Vanzeir was suspended for six games for uttering a racial slur during a match against the San Jose Earthquakes on April 8, 2023.
The Red Bulls and head coach Struber mutually parted ways on May 8, 2023, after winning just one of their first 11 games in the season.
Troy Lesesne was named as Struber's replacement as head coach of the Red Bulls on the same day Struber was fired.
The Red Bulls made it to the Round of 16 in both the 2023 U.S. Open Cup and the inaugural Leagues Cup under Troy Lesesne.
John Tolkin's stoppage-time penalty clinched the New York Red Bulls' spot in the 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs, marking 14 straight years of making the postseason.
Elias Manoel scored the first hat trick in the club's postseason history during the 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs Wild Card round against Charlotte FC.
The Red Bulls were eliminated by Cincinnati in the Conference Quarterfinals of the 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs, losing in a 10-round penalty shootout in Game 2.
Sandro Schwarz was named the 20th head coach in Red Bulls history on December 14, 2023.
Emil Forsberg was signed as a designated player by the Red Bulls from RB Leipzig on December 16, 2023.
Julian de Guzman was named sporting director of the Red Bulls on February 2, 2024.
Luquinhas was sold by the Red Bulls to Fortaleza Esporte Clube during the offseason following the 2023 season.
Julian Hall became the New York Red Bulls' youngest-ever goal scorer at the age of 16 years and 87 days on June 19, 2024.
The New York Red Bulls extended their record consecutive postseasons streak to 15 years in 2024.
The New York Red Bulls defeated the defending MLS Cup champions Columbus Crew in the first round of the 2024 MLS Cup Playoffs.
The New York Red Bulls reached their second-ever MLS Cup Final in 2024, where they were defeated by LA Galaxy with a score of 2-1.
Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting was signed to a DP contract by the New York Red Bulls following their 2024 MLS Cup run.
On May 10, 2025, the New York Red Bulls tied an MLS record for the largest margin of victory by defeating LA Galaxy 7-0 at home.
The club is colloquially referred to as RBNY and by fans as Metro, in honor of the original MetroStars name.
Since the Red Bull takeover, the team has almost invariably worn white shirts with red shorts at home and used a combination of navy blue and yellow for road kits.
In 2024, the New York Red Bulls debuted a kit that resembled the red and black stripes known as the 'Legacy Kit', for the first time since the MetroStars era.
The Red Bulls' home stadium, Sports Illustrated Stadium, opened for the 2010 MLS season.
The seating capacity of Sports Illustrated Stadium is 25,189.
The Red Bulls played their first exhibition game at Sports Illustrated Stadium against Santos FC on March 20, 2010, and won 3-1.
The Red Bulls' first MLS league game at Sports Illustrated Stadium was on March 27, 2010, resulting in a 1-0 win over the Chicago Fire.
Joel Lindpere scored the lone goal in the Red Bulls' first MLS league game at Sports Illustrated Stadium.
The Red Bulls have the best home record in MLS since opening Sports Illustrated Stadium in 2010.
The Red Bulls used MSU Soccer Park for U.S. Open Cup matches in 2019, 2022, and 2023 when Red Bull Arena was unavailable.
Before moving to Sports Illustrated Stadium, the Red Bulls played at Giants Stadium from 1996 until the end of the 2009 season.
The Red Bulls Training Facility in Hanover Township, New Jersey, opened in June 2013 and cost $6 million.
The Red Bulls Training Facility includes four fields, three grass and one turf, each the size of the one at Sports Illustrated Stadium.
In April 2015, the Red Bulls opened a new 4,000 sq ft training building at their Hanover Township facility.
The Red Bulls announced plans in 2021 for a new 80-acre training facility in Morris Township, scheduled to break ground in December 2023 and open in summer 2025.
The Empire Supporters Club, the first supporters club for the Red Bulls, was formed in 1995.
The Viking Army Supporters Club was created in 2010 due to an influx of personnel with a Scandinavian background.
Torcida 96, a supporters group for the Red Bulls, was formed in 2021.
Sections 101, 102, and 133 at Sports Illustrated Stadium are designated for supporter groups and are collectively known as the "South Ward."
In 2019, the Red Bulls remodeled the South Ward as 'safe-standing' sections.
The Red Bulls' oldest rival is D.C. United, against whom they compete for the Atlantic Cup.
The New York Red Bulls ended a 12-year winless streak at Gillette Stadium against the New England Revolution with a 2–0 win on June 8, 2014.
The Hudson River Derby was born in 2015 when the New York Red Bulls faced New York City FC for the first time in MLS league play.
The Red Bulls won the first ever encounter between them and New York City FC on May 10, 2015, at Sports Illustrated Stadium.
The New York Red Bulls played against F.C. New York in the U.S. Open Cup in 2011 and against the New York Cosmos in the U.S. Open Cup in both 2014 and 2015.
The Red Bulls defeated the Cosmos 4–1 in the 2015 U.S. Open Cup.
The Red Bulls won the first edition of a trophy awarded for the Hudson River Derby with a 1–0 win and 0–0 draw against NYCFC during league play in 2023.
The New York Red Bulls debuted their mascot REDD during a home match against FC Cincinnati on July 20, 2024.
From 2012 to 2022, Steve Cangialosi (play-by-play) and Shep Messing (analyst) were the announcers for Red Bulls matches on MSG and MSG Plus.
The New York Red Bulls became the first MLS club to launch a 24-hour streaming content service for its fan base in late 2015.
Stefano Fusaro replaced Ernesto Motta as the Spanish-language broadcaster for the Red Bulls in 2021.
From 2023, every Red Bulls match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
New York Red Bulls II was established in 2015 and competes in the USL Championship.
New York Red Bulls II won their first United Soccer League Championship in 2016 by defeating the Swope Park Rangers 5–1.
John Wolyniec served as the coach of New York Red Bulls II from its founding until the end of the 2021 season.
Ibrahim Sekagya was promoted to become an assistant coach for the New York Red Bulls first team while remaining head coach of the second team in 2024.
Michael Bradley was named the head coach of New York Red Bulls II in 2025.
The New York Red Bulls Academy is the first cost-free program in MLS.
Tyler Adams became the club's first academy product to represent the United States at a World Cup in 2022.
The New York Red Bulls have won the Atlantic Cup 13 times, with victories in 2003, 2010, 2011, 2013, 2015, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025.
The New York Red Bulls won the Hudson River Derby Cup in 2023.
The New York Red Bulls set a record for most wins in a regular MLS season with 22 wins in 2018.
The New York Red Bulls achieved the most points in a regular MLS season with 71 points in 2018.
The New York Red Bulls recorded the most home wins in a regular MLS season with 14 wins in 2018.
The New York Red Bulls secured the most home points in a regular MLS season with 43 points in 2018.
Mike Grella of the New York Red Bulls scored the fastest goal in Major League Soccer history 7 seconds into the game against Philadelphia Union on October 18, 2015.
The New York Red Bulls achieved the most away wins in a row from the start of a season with 5 wins in 2022.
Luis Robles holds the record for the most games played (206) and minutes played (18,540) for the New York Red Bulls as of March 9, 2019.
Bradley Wright-Phillips is the top goal scorer for the New York Red Bulls with 106 goals as of March 9, 2019.
Sacha Kljestan holds the record for the most assists for the New York Red Bulls with 51 assists as of March 9, 2019.
Luis Robles has the most shutouts for the New York Red Bulls with 63 as of March 9, 2019.
Bradley Wright-Phillips scored 27 goals in 2014, the highest in a single season for the New York Red Bulls.
Sacha Kljestan made 20 assists in 2016, the highest in a single season for the New York Red Bulls.
Luis Robles recorded 14 shutouts in 2018, the highest in a single season for the New York Red Bulls.
Major League Soccer (MLS) was established in 1996 as the top-flight of soccer in the United States.
The U.S. Open Cup, the premier knockout cup competition in U.S. soccer, was first contested in 1914.
The CONCACAF Champions League, the premier competition in North American soccer, has been held since 1962 and was known as the Champions' Cup until 2008.
Nicola Caricola scored an own goal in the final seconds of a match against New England on April 20, 1996.
The MetroStars were sold to Red Bull and renamed Red Bull New York on March 9, 2006.
The MetroStars won the La Manga Cup on March 5, 2004.
D.C. United won the MLS Cup in four consecutive years from 1996 to 1999.
Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup in 2008, 2020, and 2023.
New York Red Bulls won the MLS Cup in 2024.
Toronto FC won the MLS Cup in both 2017 and 2019.
Philadelphia Union won the MLS Cup in 2022.
The MLS Cup was won by Real Salt Lake in 2009 and by Colorado Rapids in 2010.
Sporting Kansas City won the MLS Cup in 2013.
Which team won the MLS Cup in 2023? Los Angeles FC
Which team was the Supporters' Shield winner in 2020? Philadelphia Union
In what year did the MLS Cup not held? 2000
Which team won the Supporters' Shield in 2017? Toronto FC
How many consecutive MLS Cups did the Seattle Sounders FC win from 2019 to 2020? 2
Which team won its first MLS Cup in 1998? Chicago Fire
In what year did Portland Timbers win their first Supporters' Shield? 2021
Which team won the Supporters' Shield in 2023? FC Cincinnati
How many times did LA Galaxy win the MLS Cup from 1996 to 2024? 9
What was the first team to win back-to-back Supporters' Shields in the list provided, and in which years? Columbus Crew, 2008 and 2009
Giants Stadium served as a venue for soccer matches in East Rutherford, New Jersey from 1996 to 2009.
Columbia Soccer Stadium in Manhattan, New York hosted 1 match in the U.S. Open Cup in 1997.
Yurcak Field in Piscataway, New Jersey hosted 3 matches in the U.S. Open Cup in 1999 and 2003.
Mitchel Athletic Complex in Uniondale, New York hosted 3 matches in the U.S. Open Cup in 2000 and 2002.
Sports Illustrated Stadium in Harrison, New Jersey has been a venue for soccer matches from 2010 to the present.
MSU Soccer Park at Pittser Field in Montclair, New Jersey hosted 3 matches in the U.S. Open Cup in 2019, 2022, and 2023.
Emil Forsberg is the captain of the team as of 2024.
Sean Nealis served as the vice-captain of the team in 2023.
Carlos Coronel held the position of vice-captain in the year prior to 2023.
Jürgen Klopp is the Head of Red Bull Global Soccer.
The team has won the Supporters' Shield 3 times in 2013, 2015, and 2018.
The team was the runner-up in the MLS Cup in 2008 and 2024.
Bradley Wright-Phillips is the top scorer for the team with 126 goals from 2013 to 2019.
The team has never won the MLS Cup but was a runner-up in 2008 and 2024.
The team has won the Eastern Conference (Regular Season) 6 times in 2000, 2010, 2013, 2015, 2016, and 2018.
Emil Forsberg is the current captain of the team as of 2024.
Giovanni Savarese was the top goalscorer for the team in 1996, 1997, and 1998 with 14, 14, and 16 goals respectively.
Adolfo Valencia was the top goalscorer for the team in 2000 with 21 goals.
The team finished 1st in their conference in 2000, 2010, 2013, 2015, 2016, and 2018.
The team won the Supporters' Shield (finishing 1st overall in the league) in 2013, 2015, and 2018.
Bradley Wright-Phillips scored 31 goals in 2014, marking the highest single-season goal tally for the team up to 2024.
The team reached the semifinals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2018.
The team's highest average attendance was 21,175 in 2017.
The team's participation in the MLS is Back Tournament was noted in 2020, where they reached the group stage (GS).
In 2015, the regular season attendance was 19,657, marking the highest regular season attendance figure up until that year.
The highest playoff attendance recorded was in 2015, with a figure of 25,219.
Carlos Queiroz, from Portugal, served as a head coach from May 30, 1996, to October 2, 1996.
Bruce Arena had two different roles, first as a head coach from July 18, 2006, to November 5, 2007, and later as a part of the management team from 2006 to 2007.
Red Bull GmbH has owned the team since 2006, making it the longest-running ownership as of the last update in 2023.
Gerhard Struber from Austria served as a head coach from October 6, 2020, to May 8, 2023.
The team saw a significant increase in regular season attendance from 2022 (17,002) to 2023 (18,246).
Sandro Schwarz from Germany became the head coach on December 14, 2023.
Jochen Schneider from Germany has been part of the management team since 2022, marking the latest tenure listed as of the last update.
